title: Two letters from the fleet at sea, touching the late fight: the one written by Generall Monck to the Commissioners of the Admiralty sitting at Whitehall. The other by Capt Bourn, captain of the Resolution to his wife. In which fight Generall Deane is killed by a great shot, and a Dutch admirall blown up, and 3, or 4, of their ships sunk.
author: Albemarle, George Monck, Duke of, 1608-1670.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed by Tho. Newcomb, dwelling in Thamestreet, over against Baynards-Castle,
